# init(name:value:)

**Initializer**

Initializes a newly allocated query item with the specified name and value.

## Declaration

```swift
init(name: String, value: String?)
```

## Parameters

- **name**: The name of the query item. For example, in the URL `http://www.apple.com/search/?q=iPad`, the `name` parameter is `q`.
- **value**: The value for the query item. For example, in the URL `http://www.apple.com/search/?q=iPad`, the `value` parameter is `iPad`.

## Return Value

An initialized query item object.

## Discussion

To use the newly initialized query item in composing a URL, add it to the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents/queryItems] array of an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents] instance. Because assigning an array of query items to an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents] instance automatically encodes the name and value properties, you should not percent-encode these strings.
